Description.val:
This line item funds all aircraft modifications for four (4) C-32A aircraft, a commercial derivative of the Boeing 757-200.  The C-32A is a twin-engine, turbofan aircraft used to transport high ranking government officals worldwide.  The design service life is 30 years with an average of 10 years remaining. This funding may include emerging modification requirements to support PMA, A&AS, equipment and other government costs.

Service bulletins and low cost modifications are necessary for continuing Federal Aviation Administration certification while improving flight safety, reliability, and maintainability. 

Funding may be used to address Diminishing Manufacturing Sources (DMS) issues. 

Funding for this exhibit is contained in PE 0401314F.

As directed in the FY 2018 NDAA, Sec 825, amendment to PL 114-92 FY 2016 NDAA, Sec 828 Penalty for Cost Overruns, the FY 2018 Air Force penalty total is $14.373M. The calculated percentage reduction to each research, development, test and evaluation and procurement account will be allocated proportionally from all programs, projects, or activities under such account.

Justification.val: Where applicable, justification for individual modifications is provided in the P-3A exhibits.

Description.val:
This modification installs Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) certified crew rest seating on Air Force C-32A aircraft to allow a 24 hour, augmented crew duty day versus the current 16 hours.  The C-32A is an FAA certified commercial derivative Boeing 757-200 Business Jet capable of long range, oceanic flight operations.  C-32A customers frequently request missions requiring operation beyond the current 16 hour limit.  This modification installs four crew rest seats, in the C-32A crew seating area, that recline to a flat horizontal position meeting FAA crew rest certification standards.  This modification will eliminate the expense and inconvenience of en route crew rest stops or prepositioning additional crews, and also makes C-32A range comparable to other long haul mobility assets such as C-17, C-5, and KC-10. This funding may include emerging modification requirements to support PMA, A&AS, equipment and other government costs.

Milestone/Development Status

Non Developmental.  Commercial-off-the-shelf item with non-recurring engineering for integration.
